name: 李鎮宇
objective:
As a 3rd year course in marketing research, this course is designed to

1.　　Introduce the role, scope, process and fundamental concepts of marketing research
2.　　Provide an understanding of research methodology and its implementation (using R)
3.　　Support the student to do a real marketing research project
schedule:
Week　　Date　　Topic
1　　9/14　　　　Course Overview
2　　9/21　　　　Introduction to Marketing & Marketing Research 
3　　9/28　　　　Defining the Marketing Research Problem; Developing an Approach; Research Design 
4　　10/5　　　　Causal Research Design
5　　10/12　　Exploratory Research, Descriptive Research Design
6　　10/19　　Measurement & Scaling
7　　10/26　　Questionnaire Design 
8　　11/2　　　　Sampling & Sample Size Determination
9　　11/9　　　　Exam Week
10　　11/16　　Statistics Review 
11　　11/23　　Analysis of Variance and Covariance
12　　11/30　　Correlation and Regression
13　　12/7　　　　Course Project Presentation and Feedback
14　　12/14　　Discriminant and Logit Analysis
15　　12/21　　Factor Analysis
16　　12/28　　Cluster Analysis
17　　1/4　　　　Course Revision
18　　1/11　　　　Exam Week
scorePolicy:
Attendance and Participation　　　　　　20 %
Milestone Project Presentation (Group)　　30 %
Final Project Report (Individual)　　　　50 %
materials: Naresh K. Malhotra, Marketing Research: An Applied Orientation, Pearson Education, 2020.
